item.title: About
item.description:
About Me

My name is ZÃ©kai (Zachary) Lu. You can me Zachary for short. I am a PhD student in Sociology at McGill University (fast-tracking from MA program since 2024). My academic journey began with a Bachelor of Laws in Sociology from Guangzhou University (2019-2023), where I completed an awraded thesis.

Research Areas

Sociology

  • Sociology of Health & Medicine: Health Inequality, Indigenous Peoples’ Health
  • Computational & Digital Sociology: Problematic Social Media Use, Infodemiology
  • Sociology of Sexuality: Asexuality, Sexual Attitudes
  • Criminology & Deviance: Substance Use, Drug Policy

Psychology

  • Adverse Childhood Experiences (ACEs) & Life Course Trauma
  • Mental Health & Psychopathology
  • Addictive Behaviors

Methodology & Technical Skills

Quantitative Methods:

item.title: Publications
item.description:
Published (Peer Review)

  1. Lu, ZÃ©kai (Zachary). 2026. ‘Mapping Adolescent Problematic Social Media Use Patterns across 41 Countries/Regions: A Multilevel Latent Class Analysis with Social Determinants’. Addictive Behaviors 172:108523. doi:10.1016/j.addbeh.2025.108523

  2. Lu, ZÃ©kai (Zachary), Zelin Liu and Danhua Lin. 2025. ‘The Association of Relative Deprivation, Interpersonal Relationships, and Problematic Social Media Use in 39 Countries/Regions: Does School Contextual Inequality Matter?’. Journal of Behavioral Addictions. doi:10.1556/2006.2025.00091

  3. Lu, ZÃ©kai (Zachary), and Samuelle Fortin. 2025. ‘Sociocultural Determinants of Injury Risk among Indigenous Peoples in Canada: A Population-Based Study of Heterogeneous Effects’. Injury Prevention. doi:10.1136/ip-2025-045849
